long_desc.thetext:
Tracker for async updates for rawhide and other fedora distribution.
As golang devel packages are used only as a build-time dependency at the moment, this tracker keeps updates and other information about this package, e.g. broken dependencies, exceptions, important pieces of information and other issues.
golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 22. https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22
golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc21 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 21. https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc21
golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6. https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.el6

Package golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22: * should fix your issue, * was pushed to the Fedora 22 testing repository, * should be available at your local mirror within two days. Update it with: # su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22' as soon as you are able to. Please go to the following url: https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2015-12105/golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22 then log in and leave karma (feedback).
golang-github-BurntSushi-toml-0-0.4.git2ceedfe.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
